00052 fsal_status_t FSAL_truncate(
00053     fsal_handle_t         * filehandle,         /* IN */
00054     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,          /* IN */
00055     fsal_size_t           length,               /* IN */
00056     fsal_attrib_list_t    * object_attributes   /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00057 ){
00058   
00059   int rc;
00060   u_signed64 trunc_size;
00061       
00062   /* sanity checks.
00063    * note : object_attributes is optional.
00064    */
00065   if ( !filehandle || !p_context )
00066     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00067     
00068   /* convert fsal_size_t to u_signed64 */
00069   
00070   trunc_size = fsal2hpss_64( length );
00071   
00072   /* check if it is a file */
00073   
00074   if ( filehandle->obj_type != FSAL_TYPE_FILE )
00075   {
00076     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00077   }
00078   
00079   /* Executes the HPSS truncate operation */
00080   
00081   TakeTokenFSCall();
00082   
00083   rc = hpss_TruncateHandle(
00084           &(filehandle->ns_handle),  /* IN - handle of file or parent */
00085           NULL,                      /* IN (handle addressing) */
00086           trunc_size,                /* IN - new file length */
00087          &(p_context->credential.hpss_usercred)      /* IN - pointer to user's credentials */
00088        );
00089 
00090   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00091   
00092   /* The HPSS_ENOENT error actually means that handle is STALE */
00093   if ( rc == HPSS_ENOENT )
00094     Return( ERR_FSAL_STALE, -rc, INDEX_FSAL_truncate );
00095   else if (rc)
00096     Return( hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_truncate );
00097 
00098   
00099   /* Optionnaly retrieve attributes */
00100   if( object_attributes ){
00101     
00102     fsal_status_t st;
00103         
00104     st = FSAL_getattrs( filehandle, p_context, object_attributes );
00105     
00106     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00107     {
00108       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00109       FSAL_SET_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00110           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00111     }
00112 
00113   }
00114   
00115   
00116   /* No error occured */
00117   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00118   
00119 }
